post_info.post_title: Halliburton screws the American people again

http://money.cnn.com/2005/06/28/news/fortune500/halliburton.reut/index.htm
 
 I wonder why the American government keeps handing this company contracts? emoticon_rolleyes

 Oh, i don't know...maybe because no one else can do it. 
 
 You would be surprised how much stuff is billed to the government which shouldn't be by the way. I work as an accountant at a university and I catch things all the time that departments are billing the government that they can't...things like pens and pencils for a research grants hehe crazy people out there. It doesn't really surprise me Halliburton did this.

 Not a great response. Your University is a non-profit institution trying to push the envelope to cover expenses. Haliburton is a multinational corporation trying to fleece the taxpayers for millions so its shareholders and high level employees can reap the rewards from its profits. I won't even get into the Chaney/Haliburton connection: that adds another interesting spin to it all.
